elements.title: citrine (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that most "citrine" on the market is not natural citrine (example pictured), but rather heat-treated amethyst?

elements.title: Jack Fitzgerald (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Jack Fitzgerald was "father" of the South Australian House of Assembly?

elements.title: Gowganda (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that thousands moved to Gowganda during a silver rush, but its population declined significantly after gold was found in Kirkland Lake?

elements.title: Robie House (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the operator of the Robie House sold bricks to raise money for a renovation?

elements.title: Peel It Back Tour (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Nine Inch Nails's frontman was "baptized" by a fog machine during a show on the Peel It Back Tour?

elements.title: One Hit Wonder (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Jackie Lou Blanco portrayed her real-life mother in the opening scene of One Hit Wonder?

elements.title: Tristram Shandy (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the author of Tristram Shandy signed entire print runs of his books to prove they were genuine?

elements.title: Sławomir (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Sławomir impersonated Freddie Mercury in the finals of the Polish version of Dancing with the Stars?

elements.title: Mega Starmie (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Pokémon fans compared the design of Mega Starmie to a scene depicting Patrick Star with long legs and in fishnet leggings?

elements.title: Destination of the Month (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Destination of the Month

San Carlos de Bariloche

The Argentine adventure capital offers great opportunities for skiing, sightseeing, water sports, trekking and climbing amidst the amazing mountainous landscapes of Argentine Patagonia.

elements.title: Off the Beaten Path (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Off the Beaten Path

Andorra la Vella

Andorra la Vella is the capital of a quirky co-principality lodged in the mountains between Spain and France that offers great skiing, hiking, and lots of duty-free shopping.

elements.title: Featured Travel Topic (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Featured Travel Topic

San Diego International Airport

The main airport to America's finest city is the busiest single runway airport in the world.
